org.webchecker.forms

Class Form

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.webchecker.forms.Form

  • public class Form
extends java.lang.Object
    HTML form element. Allows user to fill in form Inputs of supported Types and send() either by Connection.Method.GET or Connection.Method.POST method.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ondřej Štorc <o.storc@outlook.com>, Filip Sohajek <filip.sohajek@gmail.com>, Jindřich Máca (Tuník)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Form(org.jsoup.nodes.Element formElement, java.net.URL location)
      Construct all inner structure of the form.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fill(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputsValues)
      Gives user the possibility to fill all the Inputs at once with predefined collection of pairs.
      java.net.URL getAction()
      Getter for action URL address setup in construction of the Form.
      java.util.ArrayList<Input> getInputs()
      Returns collection of Input for user to see them and possibility of filling them.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Form

        public Form(org.jsoup.nodes.Element formElement,
            java.net.URL location)
        Construct all inner structure of the form. Its inputs, action and method. Includes only inputs of known types and inputs with names!
        Parameters:
        formElement - is HTML element extracted from document
        location - is URL

    • Method Detail

      • getInputs

        public java.util.ArrayList<Input> getInputs()
        Returns collection of Input for user to see them and possibility of filling them. Input with null Input.value will not be send() in request, on the other hand every other Input will. Inputs are not checked for rightness of theirs values e.g. you can set Input.value for checkbox complete different, then it was originally there.
        Returns:
        collection of Input for user to see them and possibility of filling them

      • fill

        public void fill(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputsValues)
        Gives user the possibility to fill all the Inputs at once with predefined collection of pairs. First item in the pair represents Input.name and second one represents Input.value. If filled value is null, then this Input won't be send().
        Parameters:
        inputsValues - collection of pairs, where first item represents Input.name and second one represents Input.value

      • send

        public org.jsoup.nodes.Document send()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Send Form in current filled/part-filled/not filled state to his action url address. Sending proceeds different depending on method, which can be Connection.Method.GET or Connection.Method.POST. When sending fail in some way or response status code is different from 200, application wil return null
        Returns:
        response page in form of Document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if sending of the form fails or it returns HTTP respond code other then 200

      • send

        public org.jsoup.Connection.Response send(java.util.function.Predicate<Input> sendInput)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAction

        public java.net.URL getAction()
        Getter for action URL address setup in construction of the Form.
        Returns:
        action URL address

      • getMethod

        public org.jsoup.Connection.Method getMethod()
        Getter for method type setup in construction of the Form. This type could be either Connection.Method.GET or Connection.Method.POST.
        Returns:
        method type of this Form
